title: S/S+ Impossible for me as a jungler...
body:
So I got rank 6 on Fizz the other day and have been spamming him even more trying to get level 7 and seems it doesn't matter how hard I carry my games or how many kills I get I can't seem to get an S. I heard maybe it's to do with my CS but i'm constantly roaming trying to counter-gank or counter-jungle the enemy jungler or gank my lanes and if i'm not doing that i'm farming my jungle or taking an objective, my mind is literally racing the whole game every game on what I can do next to win the game (seems like I lose every game when I die a couple times idk...)

Anyways 01 and 02 of July in my match history i've gotten great k/d/a's and hard carried most of them games but still failing for an S can anyone help me and tell me what I must do? I feel like I have to just afk farm in a normal game and not care for my team if we win/lose if it is about CS, not only would that be boring but kinda troll...

http://oce.op.gg/summoner/matches/userName=epikGG

Also, no hate on my builds please, trying different stuff :P

EDIT: Okay, so two games in a row I got S, all I did was farm farm farm, ignore my team, ignore my objectives. 1 game I got fed and the other I went around 17/10 or something (cbf to check history) both with highish CS. So basically, play selfish and just farm all game to get S's, GJ Riot, makes sense.

EDIT: Had to go 17-0 to get my last S+ but finally level 7 :) 
http://imgur.com/oEVjLEc

replies.body:
this is a comment i put on another post very similar to this the guy compared two games where he went 15,1 on kha and 9,4 on azir so i tried to explain this hope it helps kinda: 

ok so u dont seem to know how the ranking system works so heres an explanation:
in your elo u r compared to other players based on cs, kda, dmg, objectives taken etc. so basically riot from what i know they take an avg of all peeps in your elo of that champion in that lane/role. so for example im guessing you are in low elo probably bronze or silver so that's why u got an s on azir. this is because azir has a very high skill cap and people in lower elo tend to do quite poorly on him so that avg score for him is quite low meaning if u get just above the avg u will get quite a high grade. makes sense? where as khazix is quite easy for lower elo and is more or less "freelo" this is the same with champs like voli yi etc. so since these champs r freelo this means a wide majority of lower elo players tend to do quite well meaning the Avg is higher. so since the avg of champs like kha etc are higher its generally harder to get an s because everyone elses performances. also your aim to get an s CS wise is 60 per 10mins for a jgler and 80 per 10mins for a laner. another little trick is if u r good enough at a champ u play u can play them in an odd role so like yas support or azir jg for instance, which is an easy way to get an S because the vast majority of players who play that champ in that role (who troll generally) do quite poorly so the avg score is quite low, meaning if u do well u will probably get an S, though i don't advise this cause its trolling and i hate trolls{{champion:48}} , KAPPAPRIDE, #freetyler1. STAY BOOSTED ILY <3
You reakon I should try Fizz support? Haha
DO IT, JUST DO IT

You are wrong, it doesn't factor in ELO. It takes good performances from your region, champion and role. No rank is involved in it, it could purely be based off of challenger players that is why you need high CS to achieve it. The fact that people play that champion badly in low elo means nothing.

Congrats on M7!

I was stuck on my last Nami token for so long. I found that the more I thought about trying to get the S the harder it was, I was far more likely to do well early and then just tilt and destroy my chances. I think the balance is somewhere around "aware of" and well below "fixated on" the S grade, once I got M7 and was just playing with the new skin I got 2 S ranks in a row :3

I'm stuck on my last token for Zyra as well and I tell you it's not easy. We had to pick champs with polarising scores didn't we :P
Thanks, goodluck with your Zyra token!

I am lvl 7 {{champion:163}}  hope to see some 1 lvl 7 like me as well

Ps: don't bother to boost lvl7 on other champs bcoz Taliyah is the hardest to get one {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

I'll give you an idea of what will actually give you an S

Kha: 25/5/13, 291 CS, 66k damage done, 50 minutes.

Notice the vast difference in the CS between that game and your games?

Well that was an S+, and that was just me playing as normal.

True that's alot of CS for a jungler, i'm sure alot of that game you were wasting time farming instead of grouping and using your advantage to close out the game so I guess i've got to do the same. Cheers :P

I would say wasting personally, i was having to look for picks rather then going balls deep into a teamfight, but yes a lot of the game i was split from the team and pushing in waves or counter jungling.

What!? How could you be so selfish!
You should be grouping with the team on Kha'Zix and fighting full team fights all the time!

It's best if you don't focus on getting S ranks but instead at improving in general. If you play well enough it should come naturally. Having said that, consistently getting 100-150 cs over a ~40 minute game is something you should work on, not so that you can get an S rank but so that you can get better in general. If you find yourself getting fed nearly every game the jungle will become incredibly easy to clear, meaning there's no reason you shouldn't. I'm not suggesting you afk farm but get in the habit of clearing the jungle amidst ganking and teamfighting so that you can maximise how much gold you have and how hard you can carry.

>If you play well enough it should come naturally.

It doesn't come naturally and i'm not sure what makes you think that.

Like for Jungle, i find getting an S follows the NB3 train of thought "60 CS per 10 minutes is what you should have"

Looks like I removed one phrase from my post. 

It comes naturally if your ultimate focus is on getting better at the game rather than getting s ranks. At the end of the day, it only takes 3 games with an S rank to get level 7 and if you _don't_ get them over an extended period of time there is clearly room to improve.
Again no, because the simple fact is, if you get fed in a game, you should be aiming to fight more farm less, but this system encourages you to actually farm more while your fed.

I might be wrong, but if you are fed, you fight and you __close out the game__ doesn't the system recognise that? If you are fed but the game goes to ~45 minutes isn't it fair game the system requires you have more cs? How's that different to any other role?

(I'm genuinely interested.)

I'm not saying you don't aim to close out the game, but the fact is you still need to be looking at around 60 CS per 10 as a jungler, this is realitively high considering if your grouping to close out the game your not likely to get any farm, and to continue getting 60 per 10, you need to either split push (which isn't helping close out the game) or farm your jungle (also not helping)

The system is counter intuitive in that sense.

And that's the same for any lane, if you group, you lose CS, and are likely to miss out on an S by doing so.

I think we can both agree that time is a key factor then. The longer the game goes the more unrealistic the averages become (not sure how that happens though, unless it is really an algorithm and not an average) so perhaps the system is flawed on that side of things. Perhaps that's why in my experience shorter games feel rewarded somewhat better.

The thing is in shorter games, generally every lane has won, and ending takes maybe 2ish minutes.

If you can't end in less than 5 minutes, grouping and ending only hurts your grade, because at best you might get 2 CS in each of the waves, when you realistically need more then that.

Though grouping and ending is the right decision, this system is flawed in that respect as it goes directly against the thought that you should end earlier in the game then later.

This is even more prevalent in games where it's over due to a surrender vote, if you haven't grouped and a surrender goes through, the team is likely to get multiple S's because they haven't had to group and waste time for your grade to end the game.

Try to farm jungle more efficiently, like starting on one side of the map and moving to the other, keeping track of camp spawns rather than just taking whatever is closest, if your laner has recalled push the wave in and reset it and try not to just sit there and wait for a gank opportunity, nb3 is a prime example of jungle efficiency

I wouldn't say he is efficient, a lot of times he isn't all that efficient he gets away with it because he is mechanically proficient (most of the time when he isn't being a boosted animal.)

Junglers in the LCS etc. tend to be the actual efficient ones (though not always the best to learn off) as they have to play efficiently for the team in those cases.
